The  current political/governance system was designed around centuries old 
ideas and information systems.  Technology and society has changed. We have 
ease of access to information and its dissemination.  The ability to vote 
thumbs up or down is already on the page.

The only way to insure that it's not money that's driving our country's

comments.author: Paul Dickens

comments.text:
+Paul Dickens
We accept the paradigm we have.  We don't have to.  We can come together 
and choose our own.  We can fund any reform candidate we choose.  We have 
more money than PACTS -  their money comes from us.  We don't have to start 
with the Right/Left question.  We can put it on the back burner. That is 
what the system does anyway (unless there is some power grab happening).  
Our win is getting the ball rolling, capitalizing on movement calling for 
change, where the public good actually comes first, and where citizens are 
responsible: true reform.

 A reform agenda could focus on things we agree are important, or 
unnecessary - (no) GMO's, sustainable energy, political and banking reform, 
or whatever we choose.  We publicize the public debate, vote an agenda, and 
then we get the best guy we have, to run.  How we get there is to use the 
tools they gave us:  Social media, crowd funding.  We expand and improve 
the models used by Ron Paul, Occupy and the Tea Party - grass roots, direct 
democracy.   

Understand most of all, that the system relies on the public's inertia, and 
our perception that it has all the answers.  We can have our own answers - 
even if that first answer is to not accept their answers.

The only real question before us is whether we continue to choose their 
vision of our future, or our own.  If it's ours, we need to take up the 
challenge of direct democracy, to define our issues, and put forward 
candidates to carry our flag.  We need to not be hoodwinked by Right/Left 
Newspeak.
comments.author: Noneya

comments.text:
Then may i ask, What is your opinion when the government interferes to 
maintain competition and capitalism? In 1911 the Supreme Court declared 
Standard Oil a monopoly and broke it up.

Most people that share your opinion are also a fan for small business, But 
a end result of pure unmitigated business and capitalism is big 
corporations that small businesses can't compete with. Like Walmart. It's 
been shown that when a Walmart starts in or near a small town. All small 
business in the town fails or suffers.

Another way the government interferes with business is through the FDA. 
It's been shown that when a business is focused with a 100% profit motive, 
they sometimes cut back on quality. This was a serious problem with meat 
industries in the 1900s producing meat that made people sick.

You would argue that in this situations consumers would quit buying meat 
some this particular company, and it would have to adapt or fail. And you 
would be right, in theory you can say that is, as it is logically sound.

However it's commonsense that in practice takes precedent over in theory. 
And in practice, all the other large meat companies lowered their quality 
as well to compete with prices. So the FDA was born to institute 
regulations in the food industry to keep food fit for human consumption and 
to protect the consumer.

Only a fool, believes in pure unmitigated business with 0 government 
interference. Pure capitalism works good on paper, just as communism and 
socialism works on paper, But the problem is in practice both fail. 

In communism it fails due to the human equation. It doesn't take into 
account for corruption, and also people don't work without self benefit. In 
pure communism a brain surgeon would make the same as a janitor, so why 
bother being a brain surgeon. It doesn't award ambition.

Pure capitalism fails also because of the human equation, when people work 
only for self interest things like quality and safety become second 
priorities not to be worried about. Also it eventually produces giants 
starting businesses can't compete with.

The simple truth is Capitalism and Communism exists as a gradient and the 
true working system is somewhere in-between the 2.
comments.author: ThatFadedAsian
